comments.body: Can you add a comment here explaining what this file is for, and giving an example of how to use it? It would be great to also add a section at the end of the README mentioning this file.

Thanks for the review.

This is a python implementation that provides code corresponding to the C++ code. With that, we have more intuitive mapping between C++ and Python than the python code mentioned in the [Inception tutorial](https://tensorflow.org/tutorials/image_recognition/) and could be easier to add visualization or debug code.

I pushed the patch with README.md is updated.

I believe Pete meant, add a comment in the file that explains how to use it. I understand you have it in the readme, but having it in the file is much more likely to be found.

Also, I do believe your description in the readme is incorrect -- this file will not be installed with the pip package as it is today, I believe. @petewarden I may be wrong about that though.
Thanks for the explanation. I'll add more comments in the file.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +13,17 @@# limitations under the License.
# ==============================================================================

from __future__ import absolute_import
from __future__ import division
